lead_paragraph: Omar Niño, the World Boxing Council light-flyweight champion, tested positive for traces of methamphetamine after defending his 108-pound title in Las Vegas on Nov. 18, Nevada boxing regulators said.
snippet: Omar Niño, the World Boxing Council light-flyweight champion, tested positive for traces of methamphetamine after defending his 108-pound title in Las Vegas on Nov. 18, Nevada boxing regulators said.
